title: Sending from a Microsoft 365 account generates Windows Security popup
content:
I have several email accounts, one of which is hosted via Microsoft 365. Every time I send an email from that account, Windows Security opens up a dialogue box, asking me to select a certificate for authentication onto smtp.office365.com. It offers a Microsoft Your Phone certificate (see image attached),which works OK, but being Windows, the dialogue box opens behind the other open apps without any further notifcation - and if I'm busy, I won't notice it, and the email won't be sent.

I've tried installing the certificate, but that hasn't changed anything.

I've also attached a screenshot of my SMTP settings.

Can anyone suggest a permanent solution?

Thanks in advance.
creator: humphries.edwin

title: Thunderbird 115 Bullet Issues
content: I guess I can report bugs here. Anyway, when trying to create an email, and using the "Bullet" option, I install a bullet, then when I try to put a word in bold or regular text, the text jumps above the bullet. Also, when typing a line that is not bold, if I have to backspace for a spelling error, it turns the font to bold every time. It seems there are a lot of bugs when writing emails now. Try using "bullets" in an email and try to type behind that bullet and see what happens.

title: How can I view my mail ordered by size of attachment?
content:
I've installed Thunderbird 115.4.1 on my ancient Macbook pro, in hope of getting to grips with my gmail (which I previously read using Firefox web gmail). There are over 20,000 messages, and I want to find and delete ones with BIG attachments. Is there a way to order my view by attachment size?

The sort-by option lets me choose 'attachments', so emails with attachments are listed above those without, but the list is still ordered by date, and the attachment size is shown only per email when the message is selected.

Any clues much appreciated.. thanks Alan
